awd_abstract_narration: This award is made as part of the FY 2017 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Donald Robertson is "Ergodic Theory." The host institution for the fellowship is University of Utah, and the sponsoring scientist is Jon Chaika.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The award of a post-doctoral research fellowship allowed me to continue and expand upon my research in combinatorics and dynamical systems, mainly using tools from ergodic theory.

The major outcomes of the award were the following papers.

1) A proof of the Erdős sumset conjecture (Joint with J. Moreira and F. K. Richter)
Annals of Mathematics (2019)

In this paper a long-standing open problem in density combinatorics was resolved with the introduction of new techniques in ergodic theory.

2) Ergodicity of skew products over linearly recurrent IETs (Joint with J. Chaika)
Journal of the London Mathematical Society (2019)

It was proved that skew-products over interval exchange transformations having the linear recurrence property are ergodic for almost any choice of the skewing function.

3) Uniform distribution of saddle connection lengths (Joint with J. Chaika)
Journal of Modern Dynamics (2019)

Almost every flat surface has the following property: the sequence of lengths of its saddle connections is uniformly distributed modulo one.

4) Mild mixing of certain interval exchange transformations
Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems (2019)

This paper proved that interval exchange transformations with linear recurrence and the type W property must be mild mixing: they cannot have rigid factors.

Other outcomes from the award's resources included supporting my travel to various conferences and seminars for the purposes of disseminating the above research and meeting with collaborators.
